resources.string: BIGZ Halloween
Suspect 1
Suspect 2
Suspect 3
Suspect 4
Suspect 5

Hello, Cryptanalyst.

Let\'s see your information... You\'re Syfer Liste, a top cryptanalyst from England huh... Ever tried to step into a real crime scene?

Anyway, before the crime happened, we intercepted a message from the killer. Perhaps you could check it out? Just go to the electronic database, please NOT confuse it with the paper database. I\'m sure you can find the way.

To access the database, just use your name. No capitals or space needed.

--- C.S.I.B Director, Athello Apona

Welcome to the Electronic Database, Listen. I heard from Apona that you’re going to have to access the Sigil Killer’s message? Well, here ya go! We’ve deciphered pretty much all of it, but we are stuck on the second word. It would be wonderful if you could go to the analysis lab in the first building here and talk to the specialist about it. I think he was Miro Jurisic? Remember, it’s not the room at the last end of the hallway. Anyways, Good luck.

--- C.S.I.B. Computer Forensic Department Director, Aring Tulan

Puzzle 1:

[Hint: The two lines below shows exactly the same information, try to find out the relationship between the letters and find what is the second word of the sentence.]

Aol mpuhs wohzl vm aol wshu ohz illu mpupzolk. Vusf aptl hdhpaz.

Progress in decoding:

The ????? phase of the plan has been finished. Only time awaits

Doing a good job so far, Liste. Apparently there is some kind of plan that is maybe related to the case. Intriguing… I wonder if the cases before today also links towards the so-called plan… I’ll see if someone knows. I’ll possibly call Dr. Qiu if that’s the case… Anyway, now we know that there’s a plan of some sort, and it’s near finished. Pretty bad news… Our investigators tracked the IP address from the sender from the last address and found a database. We’re working on it, but it seems like there’s one document that is heavily encrypted. Can you help? Just meet us at the discussion room above the lab once you’re done. I think the last digits of the room ends in a 1. When your there, send me the decrypted file’s decrypted name that you’ve got.

--- C.S.I.B Computer Forensic Department Director, Tulan

[The truth will be shown when the beginning is the end]

 

OPENING evhhvo.txt…

Gsv kozm uli yfrowrmt z evhhvo rh xlnrmt gl zm vmw. Hllm tolib droo wvhxvmw.

Hmm. A “vessel” huh… A vessel usually refers to some kind of hollowed containers---a box, if you will, but to contain something. What are they trying to contain? What is this person...or the group trying to do?

I have a feeling that the “vessel” isn’t only just a box made out of wood and stuff. We’ve found a page from an encrypted diary here, but we don’t have the time to figure every word out. That’ll be your next mission. Just go to one of the labs in the building once you’ve figured out the highlighted word. You know, the one with ohmmeters and ammeters inside… I think it also functions as a classroom for new recruits. Remember, it’s not the room at the last end of the hallway.

--- C.S.I.B Computer Forensic Department Director, Tulan

Oh. Oh no. This is terrifying. The vessel is made out of sensory organs… In a weird way this actually make sense!

Let me explain. You know about the serial murder case that happened in the past few days, yeah? They are all missing out an organ. The first one missed both her eyes. The second one missed both his ears. The third one, her nose. The fourth one, his lips. The fifth one… her limbs. The related senses are also depicted in the sigil!

This must be related to the senses somehow too. There might be a “sixth sense” somehow… I’ll have to talk to Dr. Spitz somehow. In the meantime, we’ve hacked into the mainframe of the database and saw a map. We figured that this might be related to the first crime scene---yes, the first few bodies are all moved from somewhere. Can you find that place? Here is the map for you if you want to, try to trace the path of the delegates, trust your instinct and letters will be there. Go to that place and input the same word.

--- C.S.I.B Computer Forensic Department Director, Tulan

Puzzle 4:

New World Order Ceremonial Parade:

Path of Delegate Horatio:

Day 1: Krutardia, Roclif, Chevouerdon, Panolian

Day 2: Bybia, Tampula

 

Path of Delegate Osleton:

Day 3: Bjernes, Roclif, Loskor, Moriatum

Day 4: Makhusia, Burnorumia, Hofjorvo, Minato, Migterrian

 

Path of Delegate Hyed:

Day 5: Onainsia, Moriatum, Bybia, Migterrian

Day 6: Mostian, Jistui, Isogu, Porvikemia, Mostian

 

Path of Delegate Samson:

Day 7: Bjernes, Roclif, Loskor, Moriatum

Day 8: Makhusia, Burnorumia, Hofjorvo, Minato, Migterrian

You are almost there, Liste. Good job on finding the first crime scene---you’ve been a great help, and we also learnt a lot about the Vessel, whatever it is. The last thing you need to do is to find the suspect. Unfortunately, the camera data was corrupted… Luckily, we have an AI that can mostly untangle the data. It can only do so much though---you’ll need to do the rest.

Good luck. Report back to the crime scene of the sixth victim once you know who is the suspect.

Keep in mind that no analyst knows all the information---sometimes you just have to do what you can.

Remember the words: SEEING IS BELIEVING.

Goodbye for now,

--- C.S.I.B Computer Forensic Department Director, Tulan

Puzzle 5:

[(A,B) = (word, letter)

(password sequence, location)]

DATA INFLUX. DATA INFLUX. ALL DATA SENT FROM PREVIOUS CONNECTIONS HAS BEEN MIXED. REPEAT. DATA TNFLUX. ALL INPUT HAS BEEN MIXED.

14 ? ? 42 ? 35 36 14 ? 12 46

Hello, Agent.

Welcome again, Agent Iskat Videlya. I assume your vacation back home in St. Petersburg was well? Anyway, time to work. You saw the crime scene---you know the drill. As a field agent, you need to find witnesses and possible suspects. I am looking forward to your success. Go to the building near the crime scene first---the actors and actresses were rehearsing. Perhaps they have some information?

To access the database, just use your name. No capitals or space needed.

 

--- C.S.I.B Leader, Athello Apona

Agent Videlya, nice to see you again.

We’ve received a report that some actors in the theatre has spotted a strange man running off the crime scene. Seeing that the camera data got corrupted somehow, the only thing that we can rely on is the witnesses of the actors. However, their memories are fuzzy… See if you can find out the characteristics that the suspect have. We’ve narrowed down to these 8 keywords: Jewelry, Gemstone, Glasses, Red hair, Yellow watch, Green hat, tattoo.

Once you know the accessories they talked about, go to the financial tracking database so that we can search for the transaction data for the accessories. I remember that the person governing this is Mr. Schneider. See if you can find him in his room.

--- C.S.I.B Information Department Head, Sunya Sunasapta

Puzzle;1:

[Each Witness provides one statement, only one of them are true, try to find out what the suspect is wearing.]


Witness A: The suspect do not have some of the traits.

Witness B: the Suspect show all of the traits.

Witness C: The suspect did not wear gemstones

Witness D: The suspect wears a green hat.

Is this thing on?

Hey Agent Videlya. I’m currently busy right now, so I suppose you’ll have to use the database on your own then. From what Sunasapta told me just now, it seems like the suspect purchased a lot of gemstones?

This is weird. From what I can see, there is a spike in purchasing things that are directly linked to the five senses… For what I can find, here are the gems that are being purchased by a suspicious credit card---I think it’s that man. Although, there seems to be a lot of decoy purchases. Can you help find out which city the real purchases are from? I have a feeling that that might be where our murderer comes from.

Good luck! Once you get there, go to the surveillance room and message Sunasapta from there. It’s in the third building, and it’s being disguised as an entertainment room. The spears for weapons are even disguised as poles there! CSIB really did a good job on secrecy.

You might find three documents around this room useful.

Puzzle 2:

[Intercepted courtesy of Liste:

“Remember to make your transactions in two places at the same time to confuse the police. All of the transactions will be send through the headquarters directly, then to a location where any other transactions occurred at the same time.”]

Hello, Researcher.

Welcome to China on behalf of the CSIB, Dr. Sigma Kurashiki. As a recommended researcher from the SCP Foundation Japanese branch, I trust you have a lot of experience on paranormal activities. We are suspecting that there are some strange activities involved---especially in one of the rooms here. It’s a strange room---there’s not a lot of it inside, only a piano, but lately something\'s happening there. You should start there first.

To access the database, just use your name. No capitals or space needed.

--- C.S.I.B Leader, Athello Apona

Hello, Kurashiki. I am now talking to you through a transmitter, though I’m afraid the connection is bad, and I might not be able to transmit real-time audio communications to you. So listen well.

There has been some strange occurrences before the estimated time of death of the victim. We have the data now---I’ll send it to you. It seems like it is a symbol---though we don’t know what it means. However, there should be some transcription and translation notes in your room now somewhere. Try to find enough information to decipher the symbol’s meaning. Once you know what it is, go to the symbol room---it’s at your floor. Strangely, there are some kitchen utensils in that room alongside with graph papers.

Good luck. Sinclair out.

Well this is alarming. A symbol of death… According to my resources, they belong to a set of symbols called the Greco, as I call them, because of the supposedly link to Greek letters. They are simple, but using different frequencies of light we can actually observe a pattern. They seem to...fit into another. I’ve sent you the analysis of the symbol you just translated. There should be 9 more hidden around this room. Remember that the Grecos are linked to Greek letters? Well, there seemed to be 2 in this set of symbols. Try to find them and send the two’s English name without spaces to me. I’ll be waiting in the stenography room. The room is governed by Mrs. Abbe-Dowd and filled with literature books.

---SCP Foundation Head of Occult Studies and Thaumatology Division, Sinclair

This is alarming. Alpha and Omega mean “create” and “destroy”, and is common in rituals. And those are not good rituals, trust me. Almost all of them has a purpose of destroying the world and recreating them---hence “Create” and “Destroy”. I need more info, though---seems like analyzing the meaning “Create” and “Destroy” might work. There should be a wheel of names in the room---try to decipher the god’s name using it. There should be 12 letters for your result. Once you are done, send it to me at the mythology research department. Lately they’ve been researching Greco-Roman mythology and they are learning the language of the Ancient Romans now. It’s on the 5th floor---I’m sure you can find it.

---SCP Foundation Head of Occult Studies and Thaumatology Division, Sinclair

….Shoot.

This is bad. Tezcatlipoca is the god of darkness in Aztec. There is only one cult that I know of that worships Tezcatlipoca---and they are definitely not the suspect. There are benevolent and they have alibis. I might try to contact with them to figure something out…

In the meantime, there is an obscure worship ritual surrounding a single word---but I can’t seem to find it. I’ve discovered a video of that ritual, though---I’ve left some camera feeds, annotated with movement lines. Try to see if you can figure it out.

Once you’re done, go to the signal tracking room. It is the room directly 2 floors beneath you---and then go left 1 room. I think the director there is Ms. Haley Brill…

Good luck,

---SCP Foundation Head of Occult Studies and Thaumatology Division, Sinclair

Good job. So, imitation huh…. I think I got it. I’ve talked to the Bishop of the God of Tez, the benevolent one I told you about earlier. Adding with your information, I think I can track the suspect’s signal!

Although… the signal is jumbled. Very jumbled. You’ll have to figure this one out. Only one step and you’ll find out the suspect. I’ll send the data to you… Good luck.

Remember the words: SENSES LIE SOMETIMES FOR OUR SAKE.

Hello, Researcher.

Been expecting you here, Dr. Qiu. You are the go-to researcher in the Guangzhou faction here, anyway. We have been setting up a remote database in the third building for you here; unfortunately, due to cybersecurity concerns they are all in paper forms, We could only allow a couple computers there. Perhaps you could go take a look?

To access the database, just use your name. No capitals or space needed.

--- C.S.I.B Leader, XXX

Hey Dr. Qiu,

Welcome back to C.S.I.B! Let’s get to work, shall we? We’ve noticed some unique commonalities in the victim and the five cases before, and Dr. Spitz is currently working on it. However, he has sent you a preliminary corpse report. I’ve also noticed that there is something peculiar but similar with these cases, the killer is doing something is not normal even for a murderer… Perhaps you could go look into the database? Here are the documents you might need. Once you noticed the strange actions of the killer, go to the lounge of the history department. I think it’s on the first building, though you’ll have to look for it yourself. I heard that a certain Ms. Settle is currently in charge of the lounge. Send me an email on what the killer did that might be strange once you’re there.

C.S.I.B Historical Database Department Head, ABC.

[Possible answers for the strangeness of these cases:

Cause of death, age, estimate time of death, anatomy, discovered place.]

Here are the victims portfolio created by the forensic scientist.

So the commonalities are that they all have one of their body parts removed, huh… And it seems like that they are all sensory organs. Hmmm… I can’t help but shake the feeling that something like that also happened in the past, the researchers also found that there is some weird symbols embedded on every victims neck, they looks pretty familiar… Perhaps these documents can help? Also, I will send you the updated examination on the symbols. I recall that there is a certain civilization that likes such bloodshed. Go to the room 2 floors directly above this room---that’s our occult collection, if you do remember. Text me the civilization once you’re there.

C.S.I.B Historical Database Department Head, ABC.

Updated anatomy:

[The document you found was a description of the symbols, they are known to be related to several letters, and the actual letter in this case should be related to the number of symbols found on the victim, the name of the civilization is probably some combination of the these letters. Try to combine them in a chronological order.]

Victim 1: one symbol A was found on the victim’s neck.

Victim 2: two symbol B was found on the victim’s neck.

Victim 3: one symbol D was found on the victim’s body.

Victim 4: four symbol C was found on the victim’s body.

Victim 5: three symbol E was found on the victim’s body.

Hey. Sorry, I don’t really have enough time to text you a new message, but yeah, I received yours. The Aztec civilization, huh… Wonder if there’s anything related to this case. I have a bad feeling about this… There are known neo-Aztec cults nowadays as well. A few of them are harmless, but most of them… We’ve lost a great number of our recruits fighting them just last year. Something must be related…

Try to find something---everything is in this room that you are now in. I’ll send some info as well. Go to the smaller-scale paper database in the third building once you’re finished researching. Remember everything you read here.

---C.S.I.B Historical Database Department Head, ABC.

Welcome to the top secret database, Dr. Qiu.

That is a lot of information thrown at you, isn’t it? Well, that’s for a reason---

According to your research that you just did, we strongly suspect that a neo-Aztec cult is at fault here.

Here are some files we found from Aztec ruins. These are the maximum that we can do. Try to figure out the headquarters of this cult. Then head to the room beside the electronic database. It’s to the left.

Good luck. Text me the location of the headquaters once you get there.

---C.S.I.B Historical Database Department Head, ABC.

[Somethings wrong with the text below, the whole text looks weird, try to correct the text and the location of the headquarters should be hiding in the text you deleted.]

“To give ligght, they needed a god to becoume the sun and the Black Tezcatlipoca was chosaen, but either becanuse he had lost a legg or because he was god of the night, he only managed to become half a sun. Tzhe world continued on in this way for some time, but a sibling rivalry grew betweenh Quetzalcoatl and his brother the mighty sun, who Quetzalcoatl knoocked from the sky with a stone club. With nou sun, the world was totally black and in his anger, Tezcatlipoca commanded his jaguars to eat all the people.”

Great job, Dr. Qiu. Wow, we are right on the enemy’s territory now. I would have never thought that their headquarters was right here.

And just in time, too. Tulan, our computer forensic specialist, just detected a hack in our database. Something tells me that whoever has done the hacking is the suspect. No one should have access to the files except for the CSIB.

I will now transmit the data gathered by the forensic team. However, the data is corrupted. Try your best to figure out the IP address of the thing. This should lead you to the suspect.

Return to the crime scene once done.

Remember the words: THE INFORMATION PRODUCER.

--- C.S.I.B Historical Database Department Head, Khala.

Puzzle 5:

[POSSIBLE LOCATION KEY OF LOCATION ID: LENGTH OF FIRST PASSCODE, LENGTH OF SECOND PASSCODE, NOW HOLY NUMBER,LENGTH OF LAST PASSCODE, then, CYCLE THROUGH till the end of the data.]

Encrypted Location ID: 3734628253916374392163

DJWOCKAEIDMCYTCAIEKCNDOCKELQAUCJEKSUAWNXHM***data corrupted****

Agent, I trust you finished the task assigned by Mr. Schneider? Good, good… Now we know that the suspect is likely Parisian. Great job.

There is still one more extra clue before we can recreate a 2D model of the suspect’s face---yes, we can do that. All we have to do is to find the first crime scene location.

You should know this by now, but there are strong evidence that the victim was brought into one particular place before death. Luckily, although the surveillance camera is corrupted, the audio system still works… Sort of. Look, our computer specialists are working on it, but I trust in your abilities to find out the first “crime scene”. Once you find it, go to the portrait room just upstairs to send me a message.

--- C.S.I.B Information Department Head,  Sunasapta

The monologue of this guy is…. interesting. Best to keep that on your mind, agent. Anyways, according to your data, we’ve reconstructed a 2D model of the suspect’s face. It’s not perfect though, and we’ve limited the suspects to around 5 people. Their files are shown in here. Try to match what you know to see who is most likely the culprit. Our forces are surrounding the school, so you just have to get to the interrogation room in the rooms inside to the paper databases and send us the last name of the suspect there. I have a feeling things are not that simple…

--- C.S.I.B Information Department Head,  Sunasapta

Puzzle 4:

2DELPHI TESTING DATA --- FOR REFERENCE ONLY:

Input: Red hair, black eyes, 20-50 yrs

          Output: #H100 #E111 ##25

Input: Yellow hair, green eyes, 10-20yrs

          Output: #H010 #E010 ##12

Input: Purple hair, red eyes, 40-50 yrs

          Output: #H101 #E100 ##45

Input: Green hair, purple eyes, 20-40 yrs

          Output: #H110 #E101 ##24

 

 Outputting results…

Known attributes of 2D Face model:

#H000 #E001 ##34

Great job, Agent Videlya!

I think you got it right! However, I don’t think this is the end. We’re interrogating the suspect now, and he seemed to point out that there was a major boss behind all this. We might be onto something.

Can you make sense of the interrogation? I’ve sent the video and the transcript of the interrogation. See if you can figure out the boss’s real name. Go back to the corpse at the track field once you are done.

Remember the words: SOUND IS THE VESSEL OF INFO.

Goodbye for now,

--- C.S.I.B Information Department Head,  Sunasapta

Puzzle 5:

Interrogator: Mr. Falloson. 

Falloson: ...What?

I: You have been charged with assisted murder, and we have reason to believe that someone is ordering you to do this. Who?

F: ...Why do I need to tell you?

I: Do you not realize the situation you are it?

F: Situation? Ha! Dude, I expected that you’ll catch me this time, y’know? I’m just a decoy. Looks like CSIB are really just a bunch of weakings.

I: Sorry, could you say that again?

F: I SAID, you guys are a bunch of WEAKLINGS! I bet even if I give you hints, you won’t be able to tell who the boss is. Do you know his last name and mine rhymes?

I: Okay…

F: And since I’m soooo generous, I’ll give you some more hints! If your intel is even slightly capable, you would’ve known that his last name has the same amount of letters as [DATA CORRUPTED. POSSIBLE MATCH: THIRD PASS] and his first name has the same numbers of letters as a red [DATA CORRUPTED. POSSIBLE MATCH: FIRST PASS]!

I: Thank you for the information.

F: I bet you can’t do anything about it still, huh? Even if I told you if [DATA CORRUPTED: POSSIBLE MATCH: SECOND PASS] was his middle name his name will have a syllable count of 1, 2, 3, you guys won’t be able to find him!

I: ...

 

(... is intentional.)

Hello, Scientist.

Thank you for coming to China on such short notice from your base lab in Germany, Dr. Ziel Spitz. The kit has been prepared for you, and the lab has also been set up for your usage. According to primary investigation, there are no noticeable external injuries, so we suspect that it was poison. I suggest you go to the restaurant nearby and collect some samples of the food to test whether or not the food has been poisoned. Good luck.

To access the database, just use your name. No capitals or space needed.

--- C.S.I.B Leader, Athello Apona

Dr. Spitz, nice to see you again. I trust you have already picked up your kit? Good, good… Well, here we are, in the canteen. I’ve go on and checked the menu’s of the nearest menu closest to the estimated time of death, and here are the samples. I’ve sent the analysis data to you… See if you can make any sense of these. I’ve already ruled out a lot, and what’s left are: CYANIDE, STRYCHNINE, ARSENIC, RICIN, HENBANE, CONIINE, or simple NONE.

Once you get the results, meet me in the lab. You are a forensic biological scientist. You know which lab it is.

----CSIB Forensic Department Head, Dee Oksi Ennei

Puzzle 1:

[The forensic department have discovered a new reagent that can test the presence of multiple poisons at the same time. Although the reagent are still acting somewhat weird, we decided to use them in order to finish all testings in time. Based on past experience, the data we gain can get provide an answer, but it requires some reasoning…]

Notice:

  1. When only one compound is tested, the reactant will change color if the compound is present.
  2. When two compound are tested together, the reactant will not change if both compound was present.
  3. When three compound are tested together, the reactant will change color if none, one, or two compounds present, or else it will not change.
  4. When four compound are tested together, the reactant will change color if there are none, three, or four compound in the food, else it will not change.
  5. If CYANINE was tested but not found, the result will be the opposite of what is expected.

 

Test 1: test for HENBANE, STRYCHNINE, RICIN. —> change color.

Test 2: test for CYANINE, ARSENIC, RICIN. —> no result.

Test 3: test for ARSENIC, CONIINE, HENBANE, STRYCHNINE. —> change color.

Test 4: test for CONIINE. —> no reaction.

Test 5: test for STRYCHNINE. —> no reaction

You made it! Sorry, I didn’t have time to text you, so here’s my voice instead. It’s strange how the cause of death isn’t poison isn’t it? I can’t think of another reason why a healthy individual would just die in the middle of the day. I may need further research… Anyway, here is the autopsy results. I’ve also dug up the other cases from the Sigil Killer. Here are their files as well.

See if you can find anything strange. I would look at the abnormality that doesn’t match the cause of death. I await your information in the analysis lab. It’s near you---the room also serves as a training facility for forensic biologist interns. I think you know where it is. It’s on this floor too.

Good luck. Ennei out.
The victims estimate time of death is at 3:00 pm.

...I suspected that it was the brain signal as well. Something tells me that we need further


I’ve left a brain scan for you. See if you can figure out which part of the brain is behaving strangely. Good luck! I’ll be waiting in the metaphysics lab. We might have to deal with the metaphysics here. It’s on the same floor. There’s a bunch of posters in there about chess and stuff. Also the lab is currently focusing on the philosophy of China---you know where it is. Good luck! investigation on that, since it looks like the brain waves becomes more intense even when the person dies!

This is truly very weird, what is going on in the subcortex of the brain that will cause such intense activities? Actually, this reminds me of something… Something that I read a long time before. Wait a second… here, found it, I think you might want to read this, the theory of the soul, it is describing symptoms similar to the victim. However, it is probably a little bit too old, some of the data is buggy. Try to find the crucial chemical that is used to make the recipe, I think for some reasons it is completely illegible. After you decided on your answer, come to the elemental room. It is located in the first building, I think there is a lot of periodic tables for reference purposes.

“This is a recipe for those th#t admires the puren^ss of human mind. The pneuma (or soul) was found in the human brain. It is like a light tower guiding every single activities in life. The pneuma can be extracted through several methods, and once it is ext!acted artificially, the human being will loose all abilities to regulate all bodily activities, and the >uman conscious will sink in*o the subcortex layer of the brain. This recipe requires several ingredients, nether wart, #^*>^!, monkey blood, and kitchen dust.”

Okay, aether? This information might be crucial to find the Sigil Killer. I’ve noticed that their is also a strange peak in the access of this file on aether when I found it as well… No one should be interested in such an absurd recipe expect now. The person who read the file should be related to the suspect then. Try to find her name using the data on the search engine. Remember, the result did not show unanimous times!

[Remember the words: NOSE KNOWS]
TIME IS OF THE ESSENCE. FOCUS ON POSITION IN THE ALPHABET

To the players:

This game is very simple to operate. It is our version of a scavenger hunt. In order to proceed, you only need to find two things in every information we give. One is the location where the next QR code is hiding, and the password that you need in order to gain access to the information. The location will be hinted in the text, try to relate the room that the instructor likes you to go to one of the rooms in our school. The password will be the answer of the puzzle, and the puzzle will be distinguished from the text in the app.

We are also a role playing game, there are five characters involved in this murder case. The forensic scientist, paranormal scientist, field agent, cryptanalyst, and historian. Feel free to be anyone you want, but once you choose, you can’t change you character. If you want some more challenge, we recommend you to choose the paranormal scientist, the puzzles provided is harder than the other routes.

Some of the puzzle might be a little difficult, you can discuss with other players that is playing in the same route, or even team up with others and play on the same phone. When you really can’t solve the puzzle, always feel free to come to the initial location and ask the staff for the password by telling them which character you are and which stage you are in. For example, the third stage of the cryptanalyst can be called C-3. However, YOU WILL NOT ENJOY THE PROCESS AS MUCH IF YOU DO SO.

REMEMBER, if you found a room that is not accessible, refer back here: If you are asked to go to the ping pong room, look around in the right side hallway of that floor, if it is the library, go to the left entrance to find the code, if it is the discussion room inside the library, go to the right entrance, for the small library, simply look around the left hallway on that floor.
